list.name: Changes
list.comment: - Refactored setEphemIndex, setEphemerisPosition - Fixed issue where frozen celestial position wasn't updated correctly

task.summary: Default task
- Removed unneeded files

- Refractored Planet into PrimaryBody, SecondaryBody, Celestial - Created Sun, Moon, Orbital classes - Updated SecondaryBody's axis positioning to account for changes in coordinate system caused by refactoring

- HorizonSystem now fetches orbit inclination as part of ephem - Created methods createPlanet/Moon in Main - Added constructor to Moon - Moved setEphemIndex/Position to SecondaryBody - setEphemIndex/Position now use orbitRotation to calculate ephem position - O/P now moves the SecondaryBodies of a Planet

- Celestial objects now have a UI label that follows them around - Clicking on the label will fix the camera onto the object and follow it around while cycling through ephem data - Created camera update methods in Main
- Orbit distance, and radius are now to scale - Fixed visual bug where planets would disapear - Pressing space with celestial selected will dynamically zoom the camera into it
- Added dbID to Celestial - All Ceslestial constructors take dbID as arg - Created StepSize enum - getEphemeris now takes StepSize as arg
- Removed Mesh based orbitRing, now a 2D ellipse
- Changed orbitRing so that it is now a Path of lines, instead of an Ellipse
- Changed orbitRing to be a Group of Line, instead of a Path of LineTo
- Made camera static - Orbit ring segments that are further away from the camera than the primaryBody are hidden
- Small adjustments to updateUIPosition - Removed unused methods from SecondaryBody - Removed shapeRadius from Celestial - Added second viewer stage
- Created basic functioning PlanetViewer that changes based on selectedCelestial - Moved selectedCelestial to PlanetViewer - Created getScreen/SceneCoordinates in Celestial
- Added ExecutorService to allow 2 HTTP requests to be run at the same time
- The default date range for a body's ephemeris data is now tied to its orbital period
- Ephem query now incorperates time stamp - Added Start/Stop/Step attributes to SecondaryBody - HorizonSystem now returns "1" for any body with no side real orbit period
- Ephem query now incorperates time stamp - Added Start/Stop/Step attributes to SecondaryBody - HorizonSystem now returns "1" for any body with no side real orbit period
- Added updateOrbitRing parameter to handle issues around orbit ring - Added Date and Time input to PlanetViewer - User can now query their own ephemData

- Added input error checking into Ephem Query - Changed SecondaryBody.setEphemeris parameters to (LocalDate dateStart, Integer hourStart, Integer minStart, LocalDate dateStop, Integer hourStop, Integer minStop, StepSize ephemStepSize) - Fixed StepSize.MINUTES now "1 min"
- Added Z zoom transform
- Cleaned up code, refactored out functions
- HorizonSystem now queries x, y, z vectors instead of orbital elements - This switched also fixed the visual bug with the moon's orbits
- Added ephemIndex attr
- Refactored createMoon/Planet - Made PlanetViewer a singleton - Removed animateSecondaryBodies from PrimaryBody - Fixed issue where ephem step size wasn't update after a query

- Refactored HorizonSystem.pixelKmScale - Refactored Main, no longer has any members as a class - Reorganized PlanetsCamera.initializeKeyEvents, renamed and refactored various things - Removed unneeded transformations from SecondaryBody, reorgnaized code,

- Added primaryConnection Cylinder to visualize Planet/Moon alignment - Removed PlanetViewer.singleton, replaced PlanetViewer constructor with PlanetViewer.initializePlanetViewer - Added disable selected orbit and global hide behind orbit

- Generalized updateConnectionLine - Fixed issue where camerae Z translate wasn't zooming/following celestial correctly - Fixed issue with SecondaryBody.updateConnectionLine where - sign was missing - Added boolean parameter to SecondaryBody.setEphemIndex to prevent unnecessary overhead is moving primaryConnection
- Refactored setEphemIndex, setEphemerisPosition - Fixed issue where frozen celestial position wasn't updated correctly

MESSAGE.value: - HorizonSystem now fetches orbit inclination as part of ephem - Created methods createPlanet/Moon in Main - Added constructor to Moon - Moved setEphemIndex/Position to SecondaryBody - setEphemIndex/Position now use orbitRotation to calculate ephem position - O/P now moves the SecondaryBodies of a Planet

- Celestial objects now have a UI label that follows them around - Clicking on the label will fix the camera onto the object and follow it around while cycling through ephem data - Created camera update methods in Main
- Orbit distance, and radius are now to scale - Fixed visual bug where planets would disapear - Pressing space with celestial selected will dynamically zoom the camera into it
- Added dbID to Celestial - All Ceslestial constructors take dbID as arg - Created StepSize enum - getEphemeris now takes StepSize as arg
- Removed Mesh based orbitRing, now a 2D ellipse
- Changed orbitRing so that it is now a Path of lines, instead of an Ellipse
- Changed orbitRing to be a Group of Line, instead of a Path of LineTo
- Made camera static - Orbit ring segments that are further away from the camera than the primaryBody are hidden
- Small adjustments to updateUIPosition - Removed unused methods from SecondaryBody - Removed shapeRadius from Celestial - Added second viewer stage
- Created basic functioning PlanetViewer that changes based on selectedCelestial - Moved selectedCelestial to PlanetViewer - Created getScreen/SceneCoordinates in Celestial
- Added ExecutorService to allow 2 HTTP requests to be run at the same time
- The default date range for a body's ephemeris data is now tied to its orbital period
- Ephem query now incorperates time stamp - Added Start/Stop/Step attributes to SecondaryBody - HorizonSystem now returns "1" for any body with no side real orbit period
- Added updateOrbitRing parameter to handle issues around orbit ring - Added Date and Time input to PlanetViewer - User can now query their own ephemData

- Added input error checking into Ephem Query - Changed SecondaryBody.setEphemeris parameters to (LocalDate dateStart, Integer hourStart, Integer minStart, LocalDate dateStop, Integer hourStop, Integer minStop, StepSize ephemStepSize) - Fixed StepSize.MINUTES now "1 min"
- Added Z zoom transform
- Cleaned up code, refactored out functions
- HorizonSystem now queries x, y, z vectors instead of orbital elements - This switched also fixed the visual bug with the moon's orbits
- Added ephemIndex attr
- Refractored createMoon/Planet - Made PlanetViewer a singleton - Removed animateSecondaryBodies from PrimaryBody - Fixed issue where ephem step size wasn't update after a query
- Refactored createMoon/Planet - Made PlanetViewer a singleton - Removed animateSecondaryBodies from PrimaryBody - Fixed issue where ephem step size wasn't update after a query

- Refactored HorizonSystem.pixelKmScale - Refactored Main, no longer has any members as a class - Reorganized PlanetsCamera.initializeKeyEvents, renamed and refactored various things - Removed unneeded transformations from SecondaryBody, reorgnaized code,

- Added primaryConnection Cylinder to visualize Planet/Moon alignment - Removed PlanetViewer.singleton, replaced PlanetViewer constructor with PlanetViewer.initializePlanetViewer - Added disable selected orbit and global hide behind orbit

- Generalized updateConnectionLine - Fixed issue where camerae Z translate wasn't zooming/following celestial correctly - Fixed issue with SecondaryBody.updateConnectionLine where - sign was missing - Added boolean parameter to SecondaryBody.setEphemIndex to prevent unnecessary overhead is moving primaryConnection
- Refactored setEphemIndex, setEphemerisPosition - Fixed issue where frozen celestial position wasn't updated correctly

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: - Refactored setEphemIndex, setEphemerisPosition - Fixed issue where frozen celestial position wasn't updated correctly
